weeks.label: Week 1: How web works?
weeks.summary: Understand HTTP, the browser, the Client-Server model, create your first HTML, The head & body HTML, tables.

days.label: Day 1
days.description: Start Coding right away! Explan the internet architecture in 5 minutes, then explain how the browser works and how HTTP works with one example. Then start coding right away, do the postcard and explain the tags as you use then in the project. Students should code the project with your lead.
days.homework: The students must finish the Postcard on their own (there is a video-tutorial)

days.label: Day 2
days.description: Conecting CSS & HTML: Finish the postcard and start the Instagram Feed. Review all the key concepts with your students.
days.homework: Students must finish the Instagram & the Postcard.
key-concepts: Do not use ID as CSS selectors (use specificity)

days.label: Day 3
days.description: Explain bootstrap and how it solves 99% of the pain. Everything is a component from now own.
key-concepts: Workflow: Identify the components, Copy&Paste them and finally customize them

days.label: Weekend
days.description: Students must finish all pending proyects!

weeks.label: Week 2: Wireframes, CMD & GIT
weeks.summary: Time to start having a professional workflow

days.label: Day 4
days.description: Teach the command line to your students, use the CMD challenge to make it very fun! Start with a small explanation about the importance of the CMD and then explain each command after its respective challenge is completed.
days.homework: At the end of the class, present the students with the GIT project & please ask each student to start coding its corresponding part of the website.

days.label: Day 5
days.description: Time to explain and practice with GIT in detail, create a repository for your Landing Page GIT proyect and make them clone it and upload their piece of the proyect. Review the key concepts.
days.homework: At the end of the class, present the students with the GIT project & please ask each student to start coding its corresponding part of the Landing Page. Suggested parts: navbar, jumbotron, 2 parts description, product showcase, marketing banner, contact us, footer

days.label: Day 6
days.description: Make the students design a wireframe starting from the typical client requierment specs, teach them the importance of using components and how to pick them and draw a wireframe before jumping into coding.

days.label: Weekend
days.description: Students must finish HTML, CSS3, Layout, Bootstrap, GIT and deliver all the projects througouht the online platform

weeks.label: Week 3: First coding skills
weeks.summary: Learn to loop, work with arrays, if..else and functions. Create algorithms.

days.label: Day 7
days.description: The excuse generator is a great way to explain how Javascript and HTML/CSS can play together. Do it with the students as you explain all the programing Key Concepts
days.homework: Students need to make the replits about javascript and the layout for the Random Card Generator

days.label: Day 8
days.description: Finish the excuse generator and help the students do as many replits as they can during class, make sure to help them progress as much as you want in the arrays, loops, conditionals, functions, etc.

project.title: Replit session: Do the replits with the students

days.label: Day 9
days.description: Let's do the Random Card but focusing a lot on the workflow (how to plan and begin coding), re-inforce the ONLOAD and PRE-LOAD main events and how to change CSS with JS
days.homework: Finish the Random Card and pending replits, start DOM & EVENTS replits
key-concepts: Using Math.random() GLOBAL Function to pick the cards and suites
Use querySelector() to select DOM Elements just like you do with CSS
Add/Remove CSS Classes to DOM elements

days.label: Weekend
days.description: During the weekend, students must finish all the replits

weeks.label: Week 4: React.js introduction
weeks.warning: You need to be confortable looping already

days.label: Day 10
days.description: Como es el flujo de una aplicacion (window.onload), application runtime, etc.
days.project: Talk about javascript flow, remember: preload, onload

days.label: Day 11
days.description: Finish the Random Card, Reinforce The DOM and Events concepts and work in the Replits with the Students (specially DOM and Javascript)

days.label: Day 12
days.description: React intro. Webpack, npm.

days.label: 14. Thursday
days.description: Keep working React (Tic-tac-toe project)

days.label: Weekend
days.description: Wrapping TicTacToe project

weeks.label: Week 5: React, Events & Workflow
weeks.summary: Explain how to use Webpack, the logic of events and the workflow of web development

days.label: 15. Monday
days.description: Event mapping. Dealing with state and props.
days.homework: Choose your project: Hangman or Memory.

days.label: 16. Tuesday
days.description: All class dedicated to Workflow (Javascript, React). Support on Replits and Hangman or Memory Game.

days.label: 17. Wednesday
days.description: All class dedicated to Workflow (Javascript, React). Support on Replits and Hangman or Memory Game.

days.label: 18. Thursday
days.description: Intro to AJAX. Explain HTTP Requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), Packages. JSON. Synchronous vs Asynchronous. Axios.

days.label: Weekend
days.description: Work on Facebook API Project.

days.label: 19. Monday
days.description: Finish the Ajax-JSON Project. Talk about public API's, case study: Facebook API.

days.label: 20. Tuesday
days.description: Finishing Facebook API project.

days.label: 21. Wednesday
days.description: Intro to Backend. CLient-Server. Timeline update, add backend events. PHP: file system, Echo in the terminal. Variables, loops, arrays: Javascript vs PHP. PHP->HTML. Generate a JSON file using PHP. $_GET $_POST. Templating.

days.label: 22. Thursday
days.description: Composer. Integrating React to PHP template. Finish website template.

days.label: Weekend
days.description: Los alumnos deben terminar los replits de JS, Arrays y funciones
